input_text:
Job Title: Warehouse Specialist - Palmdale

Location: Palmdale, CA

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Management, Manufacturing

Description:
Goldbelt Integrated Logistics Services (GbILS) provides four specific areas of expertise—Logistics Engineering, Measurement Sciences, Program Management, and Technical Support—serving the scientific, technical, and engineering needs of clients. GbILS values its innovative thinking and service-oriented team who provide services for a variety of federal government and commercial clients.

Summary:

The Warehouse Specialist will provide services and support to the NASA Armstrong Flight Research Center contract located at Edwards AFB, California and Palmdale, California. The Warehouse Specialist will perform duties primarily associated with SCA Labor Category Warehouse Specialist from the SCA Directory of Occupations 5th edition.

Responsibilities

Essential Job Functions:

 Provide industrial support in accordance with Performance Work Statement (PWS) section 10.7, Disposal Operations and section 10.8, Property Disposal Processing to support section 10.1, Closeout of aircraft programs at B703 and section 10.2, B703 Warehousing in accordance with NASA Instructions and Technical Directives Perform industrial actions in support of property disposal services for all excess Government personal property (supply, materials, and equipment) in accordance with NPR 4300.1 NASA Personal Property Disposal Procedural Requirements; NPR 4310.1, Identification and Disposition of NASA Artifacts; NPR 2190.1 NASA Export Control Program. 41 CFR 101 Federal Property Management Regulations; and 41 CFR 102 Federal Management Regulation  Perform industrial actions in support of disposal operations on all SOFIA and DC8 closeout materials and equipment at NASA AFRC locations. Inventory to identify/verify all SOFIA and DC8 supplies, materials and equipment that will be disposed of on site at B703 or relocated to the main AFRC campus at Edwards  Support the process to perform the disposition of all SOFIA and DC8 assets, supplies, materials, and equipment on site that are not transferred to the main AFRC campus at Edwards in coordination with the Property Disposal Officer (PDO)  Prepare aircraft part NAMIS assets to be transported to AFRC’s main campus in a manner to maintain accountability and locations correctly in NAMIS  Assist in construction of storage racks if needed  Verify all parts have correct and legible tags and quality and traceability documents per NPR 4100.1F, AFOP 4100.1-001, AFOP 7900.3-005  Receive training in all aspect’s disposal operations in accordance with NASA, GSA, and other Federal regulations and systems  Utilize NASA provided computer equipment and software/databases to perform required job duties  Be familiar with NASA publications, forms, and regulations listed in the PWS and how all work activities are performed in accordance with those references  Verifying materials against receiving documents, noting, and reporting discrepancies and obvious damages, routing materials to prescribed storage location(s)  Storing, stacking, or palletizing materials in accordance with prescribed storage methods, rearranging and taking inventory of stored materials, examining stored materials, and reporting deterioration and damage, and removing material from storage and preparing it for shipment  May be tasked, trained, and perform duties as a non-CDL Truck Driver or Material Handling Equipment operator, including operating: Medium Trucks, Forklifts, and Specialty Material Handling Equipment  May make parts deliveries to customers using vehicles including golf carts, GEM carts, and light duty trucks. 

Qualifications

Necessary Skills and Knowledge:

 Ability to safely lift to 50 lbs.  Must be able to pass NASA forklift training and certification and pass NASA physical to receive forklift license.  Ability to communicate clearly and effectively, both verbally and via email  Ability to perform the physical requirements of the position including being on your feet most of the day and lifting requirements.  Ability to be trained in the use of warehouse tools and manual material handling equipment. 

Minimum Qualifications:

 Ability to obtain and retain a Common Access Card (CAC).  Must be able to clearly read, write, speak, and comprehend the English language.  Ability to pass a background check including a clean driving record.  Pass pre-employment drug screening. 

Preferred Qualifications:

 Previous experience in using computers as part of a military or civilian retail / store / warehouse environment.  Previous experience working in a warehouse or other industrial environment and/or experience with driving trucks and/or other non-CDL required vehicles.  High school diploma or equivalent 

The salary for this position is $20.34 per hour.

Pay And Benefits

At Goldbelt, we value and reward our team's dedication and hard work. We provide a competitive base salary commensurate with your qualifications and experience. As an employee, you'll enjoy a comprehensive benefits package, including medical, dental, and vision insurance, a 401(k) plan with company matching, tax-deferred savings options, supplementary benefits, paid time off, and professional development opportunities.

Experience Level (if available): Entry level

output_json.title: Warehouse Specialist - Palmdale
output_json.summary: Provide services and support to the NASA Armstrong Flight Research Center contract.
job_responsibilities: Industrial support in accordance with PWS sections
SOFIA and DC8 closeout materials and equipment disposal
Non-CDL truck driver or Material Handling Equipment operation
output_json.physical_requirements: Ability to safely lift to 50 lbs.
output_json.company_information: Goldbelt Integrated Logistics Services (GbILS) provides logistics engineering, measurement sciences, program management, and technical support services.
